title: Continuation of the National Emergency With Respect to the Democratic Republic of the Congo
summary: The document is a notice from the White House dated October 16, 2025, regarding the continuation of a national emergency with respect to the Democratic Republic of the Congo. The emergency was initially declared on October 27, 2006, under Executive Order 13413 due to the threat posed by the situation in the Congo, which has been marked by widespread violence and atrocities. The emergency was further addressed by Executive Order 13671 on July 8, 2014. The notice states that the situation continues to pose an unusual and extraordinary threat to U.S. foreign policy, necessitating the extension of the national emergency for another year beyond October 27, 2025. The notice will be published in the Federal Register and transmitted to Congress.
